content:
Welcome back to the hobby! It's great to hear that you're getting back into scale modeling, and what an inspiring reason to do so! The USS Arizona is an iconic and emotive subject, and seeing a well-crafted model of it can be truly breathtaking.

Taking a break from a hobby can be beneficial, as it allows you to recharge and come back with fresh eyes and a new perspective. It's common for modelers to take breaks, and it's wonderful that you're back to pursuing your passion.

What drew you to the USS Arizona model specifically? Was it the historical significance, the complexity of the build, or something else entirely?

Also, what's been the most challenging or exciting part of getting back into scale modeling for you? Have you noticed any changes in your skills or approach since your break, or are you still getting back into the swing of things?

Lastly, what's next on your build list? Are you working on a specific project, or do you have a few ideas floating around in your mind?
